value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Source: Rashid, consultant on Standard Andi, asked by T. Maisak. Info on 100 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
example_source: Rashid, consultant on Standard Andi, asked by T. Maisak

value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Info on 1 000 is unclear: [alekseevetal1998: 260] claims it has -da but [authierdraft2020: 15] claims it does not. [magomedova2012] has no data on '1 000'. No info on higher numerals.

value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: кIе-л азир ‘2 000’.

value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: aʁ˳-al hazir ‘4 000’. Info on 100 and 1 000 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.

value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: ʁa-jal azir ‘20 000’.

presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: ʡɑˤb-ɑl ʔɑzir çulum ‘30 000 женщин’ [example from Magomed, through Samira Verhees].
example_source: Magomed Magomedov, consultant on Kaitag Dargwa, asked by S. Verhees

value1_name: presence of the marker in numeral 1 000
comment: Only after components 2—10, 20, when these components are alone. But look into: ʡá̰b-al azúr ‘3 000’.

comment: atas is a borrowing from Georgian. [desheriev1953: 190] claims that Tsova-Tush has native generative '1000': ша-цI-тIкъа-уз-тIкъа и-цIа-тIкъ. However, [moroz2012: 47] expresses doubts that this system is realistic.
